H0.text: The influence of air pollution on a person's quality of life is a behavioral influence.

H1.text: It is a genetic influence on a person's quality of life caused by air pollution.

H2.text: It is an environmental influence identifies the influence of air pollution on a person's quality of life.

H3.text: It is a dietary influence is the best identification of how air pollution can influence a person's quality of life.

A4.text: Exposure to air pollution may also drive mental health issues, such as depression and anxiety.

A5.text: Air pollution is an important risk factor for various diseases, such as COPD, stroke, heart disease, lung cancer, and pneumonia.

A6.text: Air pollution kills 7 or 8 million people each year.

A7.text: Air pollution may contribute to neurodegenerative diseases such as Parkinson's disease.

A8.text: Environmental tobacco smoke contains over 60 carcinogens, where 18% are known human carcinogens.

A9.text: Burning fuels like coal or kerosene inside homes can cause dangerous chemicals to be released into the air.
